docs.lead_paragraph: MOSKOWITZ--Leon D., born October 21, 1925 died suddenly of a heart attack on October 15th after spending a joyous weekend with friends and family. Leon had a long and productive professional life, working at Met Life and developing the field of group health and life insurance. Leon was married to Gloria Levy for over fifty years. After Gloria died in 2001, Leon married Ruth Eisenberg. Leon is also survived by three sons, Mark who is married to Joey, Roy who is married to Anne, and Edward; and five grandchildren, Peter, Danny, Susan, Eli and Eva.

docs.lead_paragraph: If you are taking a prescription medicine and you are older than 60, it is probably a cholesterol-lowering drug. If you are 20 to 59, it is more likely to be an antidepressant.

docs.lead_paragraph: Though hospitals must follow a standard set of procedures, researchers found “catastrophic events” like a chest tube being put into the wrong lung, a healthy ovary being removed and the wrong vertebrae being fused.

docs.lead_paragraph: Despite high rates of poverty, obesity and diabetes and relatively low rates of health insurance, Hispanics in the United States tend to outlive African-Americans and non-Hispanic whites.

headline.main: Aging: Longer Life Expectancy Seen for Hispanics
headline.print_headline: AGING: Charting a ‘Hispanic Paradox’ in Longevity
